intro: Kadua nukuhivensis, commonly known as the Hiva Island kadua, is a flowering plant native to the Society Islands in French Polynesia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal and forested areas, thriving in the humid tropical climate. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, often clustered in a rounded inflorescence. Kadua nukuhivensis plays a role in local ecosystems and has cultural significance to the indigenous people of the region.
